Clan-Villdyr.name: Clan Villdyr
description: Clan Villdyr is one of the major clans of Lemuria. The Clan's primary holdings are located in central Lemuria, with the clan's great hall located in the city of Dunndag.

Clan-Sjomann.name: Clan Sjomann
description: Clan Sjomann is one of the major clans of Lemuria. The Clan's primary holdings are located in the southeast of Lemuria, with the clan's great hall located in the city of Ketrizyn.

Important Members: High King Skeggi Sjomann (@*Former High King of Lemuria*@)

Clan-Tordenfødt.name: Clan Tordenfødt
description: Clan Tordenfødt is one of the major clans of Lemuria. The Clan's primary holdings are located in eastern Lemuria, with the clan's great hall located in the city of Ozeresk.

Clan-Arnbjorg.name: Clan Arnbjorg
description: Clan Arnbjorg is one of the major clans of Lemuria. The Clan's primary holdings are located in western Lemuria, with the clan's great hall located in the city of Postek. The clan chieftain of the Arnbjorgs is Ulfrica Arnbjorg. Other, subordinate chiefs include Hakon Arnbjorg, Selby Arnbjorg, Balder Arnbjorg and Vigdis Arnbjorg.

Investments and Patronage: Like all of the Clans of Lemuria, Clan Arnbjorg has a wide variety of clansfolk involved in various trades and businesses. Many of these are directly tied to the noble members of the clan. Most nobles do not directly involve themselves in these businesses, instead expecting regular returns on their investments. Those nobles that do directly involve themselves in commerce are generally are more inclined avoid the volatile world of @~Lemurian~@ politics.

Clan Arnbjorg is the largest producer of boats and longships in Lemuria. Many of the shipyards in the realm, which produce the well known Lemurian longships, are owned by Clan Arnbjorg. This focus on ship building and sailing has lead to clansfolk being regarded as the most successful traders and explorers in the realm.

Other businesses run by Arnbjorg include timberyards, forestries and carpenters. The Arnbjorg's strict focus on timber works and their unusually large population of half-elves has often been used as the butt end of jokes by other clans. This investment in vertical integration is intended to keep resource and operational costs low in order to maximize profits.
The clan chiefs of Arnbjorg have a long history of patronizing

Clan-Bjørsel.name: Clan Bjørsel
description: Clan Bjørsel is one of the major clans of Lemuria. The Clan's primary holdings are located in central Lemuria, with the clan's great hall located in the city of Eldskog.

Clans-of-Lemuria.name: Clans of Lemuria
description: @+Lemurian Clans+@ are familial, or geographic groups which give a sense of shared identity and descent to members. Clans generally identify with geographical areas originally controlled by their founders, sometimes with an ancestral castle or settlement, and clan gatherings.

It is a common misconception outside of Lemuria that every person who bears a clan's name is a lineal descendant of the chieftains. Many clansfolk, although not related to the chieftain, took the chieftain's surname as their own to either show solidarity, or to obtain basic protection, or for much needed sustenance. Most of the followers of a clan are tenants, who supply labor to the clan leaders.

Minor Clans of Lemuria: The @*Minor Clans of Lemuria*@ are clans that lack in economic, military or political influence compared to the major clans of the Realm of Lemuria. Most minor clans are vassals of a larger, more influential clan, though some are large enough to act autonomously. The term @*minor clan*@ casts a wide net, from large clans which simply lack influence in the Clan Council of Lemuria, down to extended families that live in isolated villages in the wilds of the realm.
Administration and Culture: The official registry of clans is kept in the Storsal Helter in Kilurus. To be considered a clan, a family must simply declare themselves an independent clan with a name and banner. This laissez faire culture towards clan status means that the number of clans in Lemuria has risen and fallen dramatically over the course of the kingdom's history, as families die out or new ones declare their independent clan status.

Beyond the official record of clans, the major clans tend to keep private records of their vassals. These records are used to determine levy tithes, taxation and the expected number of prominent political positions a clan might expect within a clan council.
Independent & Vassal Clans: A list of clans and their status is as follows:

Clan-Alding.name: Clan Alding
description: Clan Alding is one of the independent, minor clans of Lemuria. The clan's only holding is the town of Solleron.

Clan-Kvalheim.name: Clan Kvalheim
description: Clan Kvalheim is one of the independent, minor clans of Lemuria. The clan's only holding is the town of Darminsk.

Clan-Falklyng.name: Clan Falklyng
description: Clan Falklyng is one of the independent, minor clans of Lemuria. The clan's only holding is the town of Murmont.

Clan-Nygard.name: Clan Nygard
description: Clan Nygard is one of the independent, minor clans of Lemuria. The clan's only holding is the town of Romlund.

Clan-Völsung.name: Clan Völsung
description: Clan Völsung is one of the independent, minor clans of Lemuria. The clan's only holding is the town of Elverun.
